CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 12, 1964, pg. 14 reads: " "CARE" For Liberia, Hong Kong - Instead of exchanging gifts at their annual Christmas party, at Rodman Street Baptist Church, last Friday evening, the Interdenominational Ministers' Wives brought their gifts for others. Tai Yam Tong of Hong Kong and David Howard of Liberia were special guests for the evening.  The hostesses have requested that their CARE packages by sent to these countries.  Hostesses and guests are, left to right, seated: Mrs. W. Green, Mrs. D.A. Darkins, The Rev. and Mrs. J.A. Williams, the Rev. and Mrs. G. L. Bowick, hosts; Mrs. J.G. Magee, president; Mr. Tong and Mr. Howard, guests; Mrs. S. Shields and Mrs. W.D. Petett.  Standing: Mmes. Evelyn Story, E.L. Roberts, G.W. Coles, A. Kelly, S.A. Thurston, W.A. Jones, B.S. Mason, J.B. Howard, H.W. Massie, H.H. Gaines, J.G. Harris, J. Schlosser, L.E. Roache and J.B. Cayce. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Interdenominational Ministers' Wives members and guests Tai Yam Tong and David Howard, seated fourth and third from right, gathered at banquet table for annual Christmas party, in Rodman Street Baptist Church
